item.description:

item.title: Florida Refinance Documentation Checklist: What Lenders Actually Need
item.description:
Refinance documentation feels overwhelming until you know what lenders actually need. Here’s the full checklist, broken down by category, so you can prepare before you start shopping Florida lenders.

Why Documentation Matters for Refinance

Lenders need to verify three things:

  1. You can afford the new payment (income and employment)
  2. You have reserves for unexpected costs (assets)
  3. The property is worth what you claim (appraisal and property docs)

Even if you’re just doing rate-and-term with no cash-out, lenders still verify everything. Refinance isn’t a rubber stamp—it’s a new loan with new underwriting.

item.title: Self-Employed Borrowers in Florida: Documentation and Mortgage Qualification
item.description:
Self-employed borrowers in Florida face different documentation requirements than W-2 wage earners. Understanding what loan officers need, how they verify income, and how to strengthen your application increases approval odds and may unlock better rates.

What Counts as Self-Employment Income?

Self-employment includes:

  • Sole proprietors
  • Partnership income
  • S-corporation owners
  • LLC members
  • Freelancers and consultants
  • Real estate investors
  • Business owners with employees

Each structure has different documentation requirements, but the principle is the same: proving consistent, documented income.
